content_data.hook: Why some people thrive under pressure while others crumble—then outperform everyone when things calm down.
content_data.function: Controls dopamine clearance rate in the prefrontal cortex. Fast version clears dopamine 4x faster than slow version.

genotypes.traits: Fast dopamine clearance. Calm under pressure. Needs stimulation for focus.
Intermediate dopamine clearance. Adaptable to various conditions.
Slow dopamine clearance. Superior memory and attention. Stress-sensitive but cognitively advantaged in calm settings.

content_data.hook: Your NAD+ levels drop 50% by middle age. These precursors can push them back up—restoring cellular energy and repair capacity.
content_data.mechanism: NMN and NR are converted to NAD+, supporting sirtuins, PARP enzymes for DNA repair, and mitochondrial function.
evidence: 2021 Science study: NMN improved insulin sensitivity in prediabetic women
Trials showing improved arterial function and blood pressure
Exercise capacity enhancement in multiple studies

content_data.hook: Two people eat identical meals. One's glucose barely moves; the other spikes to 180. Same food, completely different metabolic responses.
key_points: Individual glycemic responses vary 3-fold for identical foods
Genetics (TCF7L2, MTNR1B), microbiome, sleep, and meal timing all influence response
Glucose variability matters as much as average levels
content_data.why_it_matters: Every glucose spike triggers glycation, oxidative stress, inflammation, and crashes that drive cravings. Real-time feedback turns nutrition from guesswork into precision.
content_data.key_study: Weizmann Institute 2015: 800 people, standardized meals—glycemic index predicted almost nothing about personal response

content_data.hook: The 'high-risk' ε4 is actually the ORIGINAL version. Apes only have ε4. The protective ε3 emerged ~220,000 years ago; ε2 even more recently. Evolution in real-time.
content_data.function: Affects brain amyloid clearance, cholesterol processing, and neuronal repair.

genotypes.traits: 3-15x AD risk. But optimized for ancestral environment—infection, parasites, scarce calories.
Lower Alzheimer's risk. 2x more likely to become centenarians. Most recent variant ~80K years ago.

clinical_implications: FINGER trial: lifestyle intervention reduced cognitive decline 60% in high-risk individuals
ε4 carriers benefit MOST from prevention
Guides aggressiveness of cardiovascular and brain health protocols
content_data.evolutionary_context: ε4 likely provided advantages in ancestral environment: better immune response, more efficient fat metabolism, enhanced fertility. Modern longevity turned an asset into a liability.

content_data.hook: Old mice got younger when given young blood. But removing old blood factors may matter more than adding young ones.
content_data.mechanism: TPE removes accumulated pro-aging factors: inflammatory cytokines (IL-6, TNF-α), SASP factors, AGEs, autoantibodies, and toxins.
evidence: UC Berkeley 2020: Simple plasma dilution with saline and albumin produced rejuvenation effects
AMBAR trial: Cognitive improvement in Alzheimer's patients
Established procedure used for decades in autoimmune conditions
considerations: Optimal protocols for longevity still being developed
Not yet mainstream for anti-aging indication

content_data.hook: Your LDL-C could be 'optimal' while your actual cardiovascular risk is through the roof. ApoB tells the real story.
key_points: LDL-C estimates cholesterol cargo; ApoB counts atherogenic particles
~20% of people have discordance—normal LDL-C but elevated ApoB
One ApoB = one potentially artery-clogging particle
European guidelines now recommend ApoB as primary target
content_data.why_it_matters: It's not how much cholesterol—it's how many particles are trying to enter your artery walls.

content_data.hook: 40% of people have a gene variant that impairs one of the body's most fundamental biochemical processes—and most don't know it.
content_data.function: Converts folate to its active form (5-MTHF), essential for methylation—billions of reactions per second controlling gene expression, neurotransmitter synthesis, and detoxification.

genotypes.traits: 65% enzyme activity. May benefit from methylfolate.
30% enzyme activity. Needs methylated B vitamins. Higher homocysteine risk.

clinical_implications: Synthetic folic acid builds up unconverted in T/T individuals
Solution: bypass with methylfolate (5-MTHF) and methylcobalamin
references: Liew & Gupta 2015 European Journal of Medical Genetics

content_data.hook: A 15-amino-acid sequence from gastric juice that accelerates healing of tendons, ligaments, gut lining, and more.

peptides.name: TB-500
peptides.description: Thymosin Beta-4. Promotes cell migration and angiogenesis.

peptides.name: GHK-Cu
peptides.description: Copper tripeptide. Collagen synthesis and wound healing.

references: Sikiric et al. 2014 Current Pharmaceutical Design
Philp & Kleinman 2010 Annals of the NY Academy of Sciences

content_data.hook: A $100 scan that directly shows atherosclerosis in your arteries—not proxies, not predictions, actual disease.

score_scale.risk: <1% 10-year event risk regardless of other factors

key_points: More predictive than Framingham, advanced lipids, or CRP

content_data.hook: Researchers tested hundreds of elite sprinters. Almost none have the X/X genotype. Zero Olympic 100m finalists with X/X.
content_data.function: Encodes alpha-actinin-3, a structural protein found only in fast-twitch muscle fibers.

genotypes.traits: Full alpha-actinin-3. Optimized fast-twitch fibers. Power advantage.
No alpha-actinin-3. Fast-twitch fibers shift toward endurance. Enhanced fatigue resistance.

references: Yang et al. 2003 American Journal of Human Genetics

content_data.hook: The only drug that extends lifespan in every species tested—from yeast to mammals. Now being studied in humans.
content_data.mechanism: Intermittent mTOR inhibition switches cells from 'growth mode' to 'repair mode', activating autophagy and cellular cleanup.
effects: Improves immune function at low doses
evidence: ITP studies: 9-14% lifespan extension in mice
Works even when started late in life
references: Mannick et al. 2014 Science Translational Medicine

content_data.hook: Your fasting glucose can be 'normal' for a decade while insulin climbs—and damage accumulates. Why isn't insulin tested routinely?
key_points: Fasting glucose is a lagging indicator—rises AFTER resistance established
Fasting insulin is a leading indicator—rises YEARS before glucose problems
HOMA-IR combines both for better assessment
Early detection enables reversal before prediabetes diagnosis

content_data.hook: This single gene metabolizes 25% of all prescription drugs. Your variant determines if a standard dose is perfect, useless, or dangerous.

metabolizer_types.effect: Burns through drugs too fast. Standard doses may fail.
Slower processing. May need dose reduction.

references: Crews et al. 2014 Clinical Pharmacology & Therapeutics

content_data.hook: Your pineal gland shrinks with age. Melatonin production drops. These peptides don't just help sleep—they restore the machinery that makes it.
Your gut makes 90% of your serotonin. Depression, anxiety, and brain fog may start in your intestines—not your head.
The only gene consistently linked to longevity across multiple human populations. Centenarians are 2.7x more likely to carry the protective variant.

genotypes.effect: Enhanced stress resistance, autophagy, and DNA repair

content_data.hook: Stem cells work largely by what they secrete, not what they become. Exosomes deliver the regenerative signals—without the cells.
content_data.mechanism: 30-150nm vesicles carrying proteins, lipids, and RNA that transfer regenerative instructions between cells

content_data.hook: What doesn't kill you literally makes you stronger—if the dose is right. Small stresses trigger adaptive responses that leave you more resilient.

title: Factor V Leiden - The Clotting Gene

content_data.hook: The most common inherited clotting disorder. 5% of Caucasians carry it—most don't know until their first blood clot.
Growth hormone declines 14% per decade after 30. These peptides don't add synthetic GH—they stimulate your pituitary to make more of your own.
references: Teichman et al. 2006 Journal of Clinical Endocrinology & Metabolism

content_data.hook: Standard screening catches 5 cancer types. MCED blood tests can detect signals from 50+ cancers—including pancreatic, ovarian, and others we've never screened for.
references: Klein et al. 2021 Annals of Oncology (PATHFINDER)

content_data.hook: The brain's 'Miracle-Gro'—essential for growing new neurons, forming memories, and learning. The Val66Met variant affects 30% of people.

genotypes.traits: Normal BDNF secretion, efficient memory formation
Reduced activity-dependent BDNF, benefits MORE from boosting activities

content_data.hook: Chronic inflammation drives aging and disease. These peptides modulate the immune response—calming overactivity without suppressing defense.
references: Garaci 2007 Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences

content_data.hook: Your DNA sustains 100,000+ damaging events daily. Aging isn't just accumulated damage—it's declining repair capacity.
